title: PASTA DE ENVIADOS DO THUNDERBIRD FICA COM 0 KB DO NADA
content:
Bom dia, gostaria de uma orientação para um problema que ocorreu em algumas máquinas aqui da minha empresa.

Usamos o Thunderbird como cliente de email e em algumas máquinas ocorreu um problema semelhante com a pasta de itens enviados.

Do nada, o usuário abre o thunderbird e na hora de enviar o email aparece uma mensagem dizendo que não é possível copiar a mensagem enviada porque o HD está cheio. Então a pasta de Enviados "some" e quando vou verificar a mesma na pasta de profile pelo explorador, a mesma está com 0 kb e todos os emails armazenados lá sumiram.

Saberiam dizer por que isso acontece e se tem alguma solução para recuperar esses emails?

Detalhe: Não tinha backup da pasta.
creator: contato121

title: New UI after update from 102 to 115
content: I did a fresh installation of 115 supernova on Mac Ventura OS. Then imported a profile from 102 version All is working well but the UI still looks like 102. No additional thems are installed, I would like to have the new UI features on it. Thanks, Mariano
creator: mpcaruso

title: Is there any add on for Import/Export under 115.1?
content: I used to be able to use Import/Export add on for previous versions but I dont see any for the latest version.

content: Imbedded images in received emails are not visible.

title: Email account says connected, but nothing updates
content:
On Thunderbird 102.14.0 Windows 10

I have 3 email accounts configured: -hotmail -IMAP x2

At some point all emails stopped working. In the footer bar, when I click on each inox, I see the "email address": connected to "email.server..."

But the top tab icon just bounces left & right and now new emails appear. I can access my account via another email client.

I have no idea why thunderbird does not seem able to update and email accounts.

Thank you for any suggestions.
creator: Ice70

title: TB says there isn't enough disk space even when there is
content:
I have an admittedly-large number of messages in Thunderbird, up around 500 in the inbox alone. Still, as I continue to clean them out, I keep getting the message that my hard drive is close to full (it's actually over 50% free space), and that I need to empty trash / compact folders etc.

Is this something that will go away on its own as I continue with the clean-out process, or a sign of something else?

TB 115.1.0 on Windows 10 Pro 64-bit, 8GB RAM, 500GB HDD

B
creator: Dale_Latimer

title: Thunderbird subscription & 15 day trial
content:
I have just set up a mailfence email account and not that it is only a 15 day trial.

I see that I need to have a subscription to continue receiving the full benefits of Thunderbird but cannot find details of the subscriptions. Will I continue to receive these benefits if I make a donation?

Thank you. Iain Jack
creator: iain.jack

title: Deleted emails do not go into trash bin
content: I recently installed version 115. Everything migrated well. Except my trash bin is now empty. Deleting any email from the Inbox does not send the email to the trash bin. It just disappears. All other behavior is perfectly normal.
creator: mail@vorstaedt.de

title: Issue with Email Addition in Thunderbird: Security Risk Alert
content:
Hello!

I recently updated to Thunderbird version 115.1.0 on macOS. Post-update and after altering my email password (a routine I follow every 6 months), I've encountered a snag when trying to log in or add my email account using the OAuth2 authentication. Oddly, the built-in Thunderbird browser displays an error (reference attached screenshots). Yet, when I access the same link via Firefox or other browsers, everything appears normal with no issues pertaining to the link or its SSL certificate: https://id-provider.uoc.edu/....

Would greatly appreciate any guidance on this.

Thank you so much!
creator: TwoUpQuarks

title: Not receiving emails
content: Hi, Been receiving email fine for ages and this morning get this message Authentication failure while connecting to server outlook.office365.com Have not made any changes in server settings and sercurity is still set to, Connection: SSL/TLS Authnication: OAuth2 Any ideas? Thanks

title: problems with outgoing server user names
content: I have 4 outlook.com email accounts that I use on Thunderbird. I have found that smtp-mail.outlook.com works best for me. When I change the user name for email1@outlook.com the username for email2@outlook.com changes to match email1. I was using Thunderbird 102.xx.x everything was working well, when I upgraded to 115.1.0 Thunderbird forgot all of my passwords and this issue with the outgoing server name appeared. Any help to fix this problem will be appreciated. Thanks, Rob
creator: rob.1947
